graph.core

Interface IGraph<V,E>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EdgeListGraph

    public interface IGraph<V,E>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean areAdjacent(IVertex<V> v, IVertex<V> w)
      Find whether two vertices are adjacent.
      IIterator<IEdge<E>> edges()
      Find all the edges in the graph.
      IVertex<V>[] endVertices(IEdge<E> e)
      Find the vertices that are connected by a given Edge.

    • Method Detail

      • endVertices

        IVertex<V>[] endVertices(IEdge<E> e)
        Find the vertices that are connected by a given Edge.
        Parameters:
        e - An edge.
        Returns:
        An array (of length 2) containing the two end vertices of e.

      • opposite

        IVertex<V> opposite(IVertex<V> v,
                    IEdge<E> e)
        Find the Vertex that is opposite v if traveling along edge e. In other words, e connects v to which other vertex?
        Parameters:
        v - The vertex to begin at.
        e - The edge to travel along.
        Returns:
        The vertex opposite v along edge e.

      • areAdjacent

        boolean areAdjacent(IVertex<V> v,
                    IVertex<V> w)
        Find whether two vertices are adjacent. Two vertices are adjacent if there is an edge that connects them directly.
        Parameters:
        v - The first vertex to check.
        w - The second vertex to check.
        Returns:
        true if v and w are connected by an edge, false otherwise.

      • replace

        V replace(IVertex<V> v,
          V o)
        Replace the element of vertex v with a new element (o).
        Parameters:
        v - The vertex whose element should be changed.
        o - The new element to store at this vertex.
        Returns:
        The old element that was stored in v before this method was called.

      • replace

        E replace(IEdge<E> e,
          E o)
        Replace the element of edge e with a new element (o).
        Parameters:
        e - The edge whose element should be changed.
        o - The new element to store at this edge.
        Returns:
        The old element that was stored in e before this method was called.

      • insertVertex

        IVertex<V> insertVertex(V o)
        Insert a new vertex into the graph. The element in the new vertex is given as parameter o.
        Parameters:
        o - The element to be stored in the new vertex.
        Returns:
        The vertex that was created.

      • insertEdge

        IEdge<E> insertEdge(IVertex<V> v,
                    IVertex<V> w,
                    E o)
        Insert a new edge into the graph. The edge should connect the vertices v and w, and have element o.
        Parameters:
        v - The first vertex to connect.
        w - The second vertex to connect.
        o - The element to store in this edge.
        Returns:
        The new edge that is created.

      • removeVertex

        V removeVertex(IVertex<V> v)
        Remove a vertex from the graph.
        Parameters:
        v - The vertex to be removed.
        Returns:
        The element that was stored at that vertex before it was removed.

      • removeEdge

        E removeEdge(IEdge<E> e)
        Remove an edge from the graph.
        Parameters:
        e - The edge to be removed.
        Returns:
        The element that was stored at that edge before it was removed.

      • incidentEdges

        IIterator<IEdge<E>> incidentEdges(IVertex<V> v)
        Find the edges that are incident on v. This is should be an iterator that can iterate over all the edges that are connected to vertex v.
        Parameters:
        v - The vertex that the edges should be connected to.
        Returns:
        An iterator that can iterate over all the edges connected to v.

      • vertices

        IIterator<IVertex<V>> vertices()
        Find all the vertices in the graph.
        Returns:
        An iterator that can iterate over all the vertices in the graph.

      • edges

        IIterator<IEdge<E>> edges()
        Find all the edges in the graph.
        Returns:
        An iterator that can iterate over all the edges in the graph.
